patients.name: Robert Chen
patients.ehr_summary: 68-year-old male with history of hypertension (on Lisinopril 20mg daily since 2010) and type 2 diabetes mellitus (on Metformin 1000mg BID since 2015). Also on Atorvastatin 40mg daily for hyperlipidemia. Recent BP 145/88, HbA1c 7.2%. No prior stroke or TIA. Non-smoker.

patients.name: Maria Santos
patients.ehr_summary: 72-year-old female with atrial fibrillation (on Apixaban 5mg BID) and hypertension (on Amlodipine 10mg daily). History of paroxysmal AF diagnosed 3 years ago. Recent echocardiogram showed normal LV function. No prior stroke. CHA2DS2-VASc score 4.

patients.name: James Wilson
patients.ehr_summary: 65-year-old male with poorly controlled hypertension (BP often 160-170/90-100 despite Losartan 100mg daily). Active smoker, 40 pack-year history. Hyperlipidemia on Simvastatin 40mg daily. Carotid ultrasound 6 months ago showed mild bilateral stenosis (<50%). No prior stroke or TIA.

patients.name: Linda Martinez
patients.ehr_summary: 58-year-old female with hypertension (on Lisinopril 20mg and HCTZ 12.5mg daily) and hyperlipidemia (on Atorvastatin 80mg daily). Type 2 diabetes diagnosed 2 years ago, well-controlled on Metformin. Non-smoker. BMI 32. Recent labs show LDL 85, HbA1c 6.8%.

patients.name: David Kim
patients.ehr_summary: 70-year-old male with known left vertebral artery stenosis (70% stenosis on CTA 1 year ago). History of hypertension and hyperlipidemia, both well-controlled on medications. Had vertebrobasilar TIA 18 months ago with transient vertigo and diplopia. On dual antiplatelet therapy (Aspirin 81mg + Clopidogrel 75mg daily).

patients.name: Sarah Johnson
patients.ehr_summary: 32-year-old female with no significant past medical history. Had episode of optic neuritis in right eye 8 months ago that resolved with IV methylprednisolone. MRI brain at that time showed multiple periventricular white matter lesions. Lumbar puncture showed oligoclonal bands. Currently not on disease-modifying therapy, awaiting neurology follow-up.

conditions.name: Weber Syndrome
conditions.description: Midbrain stroke affecting cerebral peduncle with ipsilateral CN III palsy and contralateral hemiparesis

conditions.name: Wallenberg Syndrome
conditions.description: Lateral medullary syndrome (PICA territory) with ipsilateral facial sensory loss, Horner's, ataxia, and contralateral body sensory loss

conditions.name: Millard-Gubler Syndrome
conditions.description: Ventral pontine stroke with ipsilateral CN VI and CN VII palsy and contralateral hemiparesis

conditions.name: Lateral Pontine Syndrome
conditions.description: AICA territory infarction with ipsilateral CN VII, CN VIII palsy, ataxia, and contralateral pain/temperature loss

conditions.name: Medial Medullary Syndrome
conditions.description: Dejerine syndrome with ipsilateral CN XII palsy, contralateral hemiparesis, and contralateral proprioception loss

conditions.name: Multiple Sclerosis Brainstem
conditions.description: Demyelinating lesion in brainstem causing internuclear ophthalmoplegia and sensory symptoms

conditions.name: Midbrain Stroke
conditions.description: Acute midbrain infarction with oculomotor deficits and motor symptoms

conditions.name: Basilar Artery Thrombosis
conditions.description: Occlusion of basilar artery causing bilateral brainstem symptoms and altered consciousness
